remarks: There is a nonzero vector that maps to every lattice atom.  (Contributed by NM, 16-Aug-2014.)
statement:
dihatexv.b $e |- B = ( Base ` K ) $.
dihatexv.a $e |- A = ( Atoms ` K ) $.
dihatexv.h $e |- H = ( LHyp ` K ) $.
dihatexv.u $e |- U = ( ( DVecH ` K ) ` W ) $.
dihatexv.v $e |- V = ( Base ` U ) $.
dihatexv.o $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` U ) $.
dihatexv.n $e |- N = ( LSpan ` U ) $.
dihatexv.i $e |- I = ( ( DIsoH ` K ) ` W ) $.
dihatexv.k $e |- ( ph -> ( K e. HL /\ W e. H ) ) $.
dihatexv.q $e |- ( ph -> Q e. B ) $.
dihatexv $p |- ( ph -> ( Q e. A <-> E. x e. ( V \ { .0. } ) ( I ` Q ) = ( N ` { x } ) ) ) $.
$d A x $.
$d B x $.
$d I x $.
$d K x $.
$d N x $.
$d Q x $.
$d V x $.
$d W x $.
$d ph x $.
